newsitem.title: UK: UK weather forecasters offer insurers new software.
newsitem.headline: UK weather forecasters offer insurers new software.

text.p: UK weather forecasters say they can improve profitability in the insurance industry with a new product which will provide the most comprehensive analysis to date of weather conditions throughout the country.

The meteorological office (MET) said on Thursday several insurers are interested in buying a new computer model which will tell them the wind speed, temperature and rainfall on any given day at 3,000 postcodes across the UK.
The MET's Mark Gibbs told reporters at a news conference the product would help insurers increase profitability and reduce premiums by speeding up the claims process and reducing fraud.

He estimated that storms, burst pipes, floods and subsidence already accounted for 40 percent of all property insurance claims. In addition, extreme weather arising from global warming over the coming years could lead to an increase in such claims.

Weather related claims for the first half of 1996 landed UK insurers with a bill of around 100 million stg -- twice the cost of the previous year and the government now requires that they put aside some reserves to smooth the impact of heavy losses.
